summary: This document is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) TECS Person Encounter List detailing the flight travel history of Jeffrey Epstein from June 2017 to April 2019. It records numerous private flights between airports in Florida, New Jersey, New York, the U.S. Virgin Islands, and other locations, using multiple passport/document numbers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The sole individual listed in this travel log, showing numerous private flight entries as a passenger on aircraft with tail numbers N212JE, N120JE, and N415LM.

keyFacts: The document shows Jeffrey Epstein was a frequent flyer on private aircraft between mid-2017 and April 2019, a period covering his arrest in July 2019.
Epstein used at least three different passport/document numbers (469911707, 547017616, 566672615) for travel during this period.
Common flight routes connected Teterboro, NJ (KTEB) with West Palm Beach, FL (KPBI) and St. Thomas, USVI (TIST).
The log was generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on April 22, 2019, indicating active law enforcement monitoring of his movements prior to his arrest.
The aircraft tail numbers (N212JE, N120JE, N415LM) are associated with Epstein's private jets.
